title: Mum and son, 2, 'left covered in bites as beetles crawl over them in their beds'
text:

A mum claims she and her two-year-old son have been left covered in bites after plaster beetles invaded their council home.

Hayley Smith, 23, has demanded to be given a new home, alleging her current one has been plagued by mould, damp and insects.

Ms Smith claims she struggles to sleep at night "because I'm constantly itching from the beetles crawling over my skin" and she and her son Logan both wake up "covered in bites all over us", StokeonTrentLive reports.

She says her son's blankets were infested with beetles and she's had to throw out clothes, and claims she has complained to Stoke-on-Trent City Council.

However, the council claims the mum raised no concerns during its last home visit.

Ms Smith said: "I moved here two years ago when my son, Logan Smith, was three-months-old and the mould and damp was that bad you could stick your fingers straight through the plaster.

"Then after a year I noticed we also had plaster beetles.

"I've been complaining since I moved in and it took the council until May to come out and re-plaster, but it hasn't really done anything.

"You can still feel and smell the damp as soon as you walk in and me and my son are still getting ill and coming out in rashes from the beetles.

"I've lost quite a bit of money because of it as I had to throw everything away in the back bedroom where my son was supposed to sleep."

She added: "I've had to chuck clothes out because of the damp and all of my son's blankets because they were infested with plaster beetles and that will cost a lot of money to replace.

"I can't sleep at night because I'm constantly itching from the beetles crawling over my skin.

"My son has to sleep in the single bed with me because he can't sleep in the back bedroom as it's worse in there, but we both still wake up covered in bites all over us.

"Everyone who stays at mine comes out in bites and rashes and my son screams in pain because of it.

"I'm going to the doctors almost every month because we've both constantly got blocked up sinuses from the damp and mould. My son even struggles to breathe and his chest is not good because of the damp which is a worry.

"My son isn't developing properly because he's constantly ill, his speech is delayed, and it's physically stressing me out. I feel completely drained all of the time."

The mum-of-one added: "I feel let down. I've got a young child and I just want to be moved because I'm depressed living here, I don't want to be here anymore. I can't stand it every day.

"They should have re-plastered the walls when I originally complained and before I noticed the plaster beetles. If they'd fixed it at the start then this could have been avoided."

A council spokesman said: "All work to resolve the issues reported were completed in May.

"Ms Smith also expressed an interest in moving to Newcastle in April. She was given contact details by our housing team for organisations which manage properties in Newcastle. We have not heard from her since."
description: Mum-of-one Hayley Smith, 23, says she struggles to sleep at night in her Stoke-on-Trent home "because I'm constantly itching from the beetles crawling over my skin"
